definition: a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Agreement tariff and Lijin system were abolished simultaneously eventually.
sentences.chinese: 最後的結果是協定關稅和厘金同時廢除。

sentences.english: This paper is a new achivement on the research of island transit taxes system.
sentences.chinese: 本文是國內關於厘金制研究的一項最新成果。

sentences.english: Without doubt, likin played this role.
sentences.chinese: 厘金無疑扮演了這一角色。

sentences.english: It had become one of the greatest disasters in modern Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 厘金爲害之烈成爲近代最大的禍患之一。

sentences.english: Likin was a kind of local business tax , which levied in late Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 厘金是清後期產生的一種內地商業稅。

sentences.english: The rise and fall of Wuhu rice market was closely connected with the establishment and abolition of the tax system.
sentences.chinese: 蕪湖米市的盛衰，與厘金制度的設廢有着密切的關聯。

definition: government repository/state provincial warehouse (esp. during Qing dynasty)
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
governor general 总督 and inspector general 巡抚
